CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 17, 1941, pg. 5, reads: "Chesterfield Girls Make Hill Youngsters Happy - Pictured above in foreground are nine of the thirteen youngsters who were donated memberships to the Centre Avenue 'Y' by the Chesterfield Girls of Pittsburgh this week. The club is composed of young women interested in bettering conditions in general for HIll district youngsters.  In the back row are, Malvin Goode, Boys' secretary at the "Y" and the Chesterfield Girls, Mary Palmer, Jeanette Paige, Kathleen Holloway, Ann Mays, Charlene Coles and Arnetta Green, president of the club. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Chesterfield Girls members surrounding Mal Goode, including from left: Charlene Coles, Mary Palmer, Ann Mays, Goode, Jeanette Paige, Arnetta Green wearing monkey fur, and Kathleen Holloway, posed around table, possibly in Centre Avenue YMCA
